qas.question: What is dry cod known as in Portuguese?
Other than bacalhau, what are two other popular fish recipes in Portugal?

answers.text: a potato-based stew that can be made from several types of fish

qas.question: What meats are often used in Portuguese recipes?
What are two popular Northern Portugal dishes?

answers.text: arroz de sarrabulho (rice stewed in pigs blood) or the arroz de cabidela (rice and chickens meat stewed in chickens blood)

context: Portuguese cuisine is diverse. The Portuguese consume a lot of dry cod (<a0_0>bacalhau<a0_0/> in Portuguese), for which there are hundreds of recipes. There are more than enough bacalhau dishes for each day of the year. Two other popular fish recipes are <a1_0>grilled sardines and caldeirada<a1_0/>, <a2_0>a potato-based stew that can be made from several types of fish<a2_0/>. Typical Portuguese meat recipes, that may be made out of <a3_0>beef, pork, lamb, or chicken<a3_0/>, include cozido à portuguesa, feijoada, frango de churrasco, leitão (roast suckling pig) and carne de porco à alentejana. A very popular northern dish is the <a4_0>arroz de sarrabulho (rice stewed in pigs blood) or the arroz de cabidela (rice and chickens meat stewed in chickens blood)<a4_0/>.
